metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10192 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Redis hyperloglog data structure versions 3.x before 3.2.13, 4.x before 4.0.14 and 5.x before 5.0.4. By carefully corrupting a hyperloglog using the SETRANGE command, an attacker could trick Redis interpretation of dense HLL encoding to write up to 3 bytes beyond the end of a heap-allocated buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis-sentinel - 2:3.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
redis-server - 2:3.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
redis-tools - 2:3.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.0.6-1ubuntu0.4').
